newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends higher on short covering.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends higher on short covering.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures ended higher on short covering and spillover support from CBOT soybeans amid talk of a possible frost event next week in the U.S. Midwest, traders said.
U.S. wheat markets were buoyed by the frost-related rally in CBOT soybeans and by concerns over possible delays in the seeding of winter wheat.
"Chicago moved and we just followed," a trader said. "There was a lack of selling. Also, all week we saw scaled down commercial-type buying and we saw a little more of that come in today."
MGE spring wheat closed 1-1/2 to three cents per bushel higher, with Dec up 1-1/2 cents at $4.07-3/4 a bushel.
Traders said Atwood-Peavey bought around 800,000 March bushels. CIS bought 400,000 March and 400,000 Dec, and also sold 400,000 Dec. Wilson sold 800,000 Dec.
Volumes were extremely light. The MGE estimated Friday's spring wheat futures volume at 14.27 million bushels, down from 20.782 million on Thursday.
The only MGE barley futures contract to trade Friday was the nearby Dec, which ended nine cents per hundredweight higher at $7.24.
